citation.journal: The Journal of Slavic Military Studies
citation.title: Operation “Marita”: The Attack Against Yugoslavia in 1941

author.name: Tim Suchomel
author.description: PhD in Sport Physiology and Performance, Assistant Professor in the Department of Human Movement Sciences at Carroll University

author.name: Texas System of Care
author.description: Working to ensure all Texas children and youth have access to high quality mental health care by expanding the system of care approach.

wikipedia.title: Invasion of Yugoslavia
wikipedia.summary: The invasion commenced with an overwhelming air attack on Belgrade and facilities of the Royal Yugoslav Air Force (VVKJ) by the Luftwaffe (German Air Force) and attacks by German land forces from southwestern Bulgaria.

wikipedia.title: Axis order of battle for the invasion of Yugoslavia
wikipedia.summary: The Axis order of battle for the invasion of Yugoslavia was made up of the various operational formations of the German Wehrmacht and Waffen-SS, Italian Armed Forces and Hungarian Armed Forces that participated in the invasion of Yugoslavia during World Wa

wikipedia.title: 2nd Army Group (Kingdom of Yugoslavia)
wikipedia.summary: The 2nd Army Group was a Royal Yugoslav Army formation commanded by Armijski đeneral Milutin Nedić during the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941 during World War II.

wikipedia.title: 4th Army (Kingdom of Yugoslavia)
wikipedia.summary: The 4th Army was a Royal Yugoslav Army formation during the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941 during World War II.

wikipedia.title: 7th Army (Kingdom of Yugoslavia)
wikipedia.summary: The 7th Army was a Royal Yugoslav Army formation commanded by Divizijski General Dušan Trifunović during the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941 during World War II.

wikipedia.title: 2nd Army (Kingdom of Yugoslavia)
wikipedia.summary: The 2nd Army was a Royal Yugoslav Army formation commanded by Armijski đeneral Dragoslav Miljković that opposed the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941 during World War II.

wikipedia.title: 1st Army Group (Kingdom of Yugoslavia)
wikipedia.summary: The 1st Army Group was a Royal Yugoslav Army formation commanded by Armijski đeneral Milorad Petrović during the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941 during World War II.

wikipedia.title: Supreme Command (Kingdom of Yugoslavia)
wikipedia.summary: The 5th Army and the 6th Army were directly subordinate to the Supreme Command and were not attached to one of the four army groups.

wikipedia.title: 1st Army (Kingdom of Yugoslavia)
wikipedia.summary: The 1st Army was a Royal Yugoslav Army formation commanded by Armijski đeneral Milan Rađenković during the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941 during World War II.

wikipedia.title: 27th Infantry Division Savska
wikipedia.summary: The 27th Infantry Division Savska was an infantry formation of the Royal Yugoslav Army that formed part of the Yugoslav 4th Army during the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941.

wikipedia.title: 40th Infantry Division Slavonska
wikipedia.summary: The 40th Infantry Division Slavonska was an infantry formation of the Royal Yugoslav Army that formed part of the Yugoslav 4th Army during the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941.

wikipedia.title: 3rd Army (Kingdom of Yugoslavia)
wikipedia.summary: The 3rd Army was a Royal Yugoslav Army formation commanded by Armijski đeneral Ilija Brašić during the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941 during World War II.

wikipedia.title: Gudovac massacre
wikipedia.summary: The Gudovac massacre was the mass killing of 184–196 Serb inhabitants of Bjelovar which took place in the village of Gudovac on 28 April 1941, during World War II.

wikipedia.title: 32nd Infantry Division Triglavski
wikipedia.summary: The 32nd Infantry Division Triglavski was a Royal Yugoslav Army infantry formation raised prior to the German-led Axis invasion of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia in April 1941.
